quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Album and Group
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, sunrise, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What artist recorded Blood on the Tracks, the #16 album on Rolling Stones list of the 500 Greatest Albums of All Time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Dylan

questions.question: This one hit wonder had a hit song in 1990 called Black Velvet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alannah Myles

questions.question: Who released Sunrise, the #11 album on Rolling Stones list of the 500 Greatest Albums of All Time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elvis Presley

questions.question: Who recorded Never Mind, the #17 album on Rolling Stone magazines list of the 500 Greatest Albums of All Time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nirvana

questions.question: This group had a huge hit song in 1972 with Black and White.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three Dog Night

questions.question: Which artist recorded Kind of Blue, the #12 album on Rolling Stones list of greatest albums?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miles Davis

questions.question: This British group had a big hit song in 1972 called Long Cool Woman in a Black Dress.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hollies

questions.question: This group had lots of hit songs during their very successful career. They had a minor hit with the song Black Friday which came off their 1975 album called Katy Lied.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steely Dan

questions.question: Which group recorded Abbey Road, the #14 album on Rolling Stone magazines list of greatest albums of all time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Beatles

questions.question: The Velvet Underground, which was ranked as the #13 album of all time by Rolling Stone magazine, was recorded by this group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Velvet Underground and Nico

questions.question: Who recorded Thriller, the #20 album on Rolling Stones list of top albums?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Jackson

questions.question: This group had a huge hit song in 1975 called Black Water.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Doobie Brothers

questions.question: This artist released the album Born to Run, ranked as the #18 album on Rolling Stones list of the 500 Greatest Albums of All Time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bruce Springsteen

questions.question: Who recorded the album Are You Experienced, ranked #15 on Rolling Stones list of the 500 Greatest Albums of All Time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimi Hendrix

questions.question: Astral Weeks, the #19 album on Rolling Stones list of greatest albums, was released by this artist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Van Morrison

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Animal Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, bird. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Elvis Presley recorded this dog song in 1956.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hound Dog

questions.question: This flower song was recorded in 1978 by by Neil Diamond and Barbra Streisand.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You Dont Bring Me Flowers

questions.question: This animal song was co-written and recorded by American country singer Taylor Swift in 2008.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: White Horse

questions.question: What female musician recorded the song Where the Wild Roses Grow with Nick Cave in 1995?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kylie Minogue

questions.question: What bird song has been covered by artists like Josephine Baker, Frank Sinatra, Judy Garland, Liza Minnelli, Dean Martin, Joe Cocker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bye Bye Blackbird

questions.question: What carnivorous song did Duran Duran release in May 1982 from their second studio album Rio?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hungry Like the Wolf

questions.question: What bird song did Prince include in his 1984 album Purple Rain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: When Doves Cry

questions.question: This reggae song was co-written and recorded by Bob Marley in 1980, and was released in 1983.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buffalo Soldier

questions.question: What animal song was written and recorded by Elton John in in June 1972?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crocodile Rock

questions.question: What popular flower song was recorded by Nick Lucas in 1929?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tiptoe Through the Tulips

questions.question: What male musician recorded the 1994 song Kiss from a Rose?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seal

questions.question: John Lennon wrote this animal song for The Beatles in 1967.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Am the Walrus

questions.question: Michael Jackson recorded this bird song in 1971, and released it in 1972 from his debut solo album Got to Be There.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rockin Robin

questions.question: This animal song was written by Nelly Furtado and was the first single from her 2000 debut album Whoa, Nelly!.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Im like a Bird

questions.question: What rock band originally recorded the song Dead Flowers, released in 1971?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rolling Stones

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Singer
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, mama, oklahoma. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The 2005 song Blue Orchid by The White Stripes was rumored to have been inspired by the breakup between band member Jack White and this Hollywood actress.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Renee Zellweger

questions.question: Born in Oklahoma in 1903, this jazz singer nicknamed Mr. Five by Five was best known for his work with the Basie Band from 1935-1950.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Rushing

questions.question: One of the most important American jazz singers of the 20th century, she was discovered by Teddy Wilson. She was famous for her behind the beat type of phrasing and for her renditions of Thelonius Monk songs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carmen McRae

questions.question: What popular flower song from 1962 won the Academy Award for Best Original Song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Days of Wine and Roses

questions.question: Orson Welles called this singer the most exciting girl in the world.” Her signature songs include: CEst Si Bon, Mink Schmink, and the very sexy Santa Baby. Her criticism of the Vietnam War made Lady Bird Johnson cry. What is her name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eartha Kitt

questions.question: What jazz singer better known as Mama Corleone from The Godfather first hit the big time with her 1964 album A Taste of Honey?”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morgana King

questions.question: What female musician wrote the song A Rose Is Still a Rose for Aretha Franklin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lauryn Hill

questions.question: Born in the UK, this this singing beauty was discovered by her husband John Dankworth. She sang and acted on the British stage with Robert Morley and Ruth Gordon. She recorded Porgy and Bess” with Ray Charles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cleo Laine

questions.question: What male musician recorded the song Desert Rose in 1999?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sting

questions.question: This great singer and actress who lived from 1896-1977 was the first African-American to star on a national radio show. She was sometimes called Sweet Mama Stringbean.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ethel Waters

questions.question: This real beauty was born in Brooklyn in 1917. Her first mentors were Cab Calloway and Duke Ellington. A great singer and actress, she appeared in Panama Hattie, Cabin in the Sky” and Show Boat. Her signature song is Stormy Weather.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lena Horne

questions.question: What flower song was released by Bon Jovi in 1992?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bed of Roses

questions.question: This Michigan-born jazz great was never as popular as other vocalists but was admired by her peers. Her signature song was “Open the Door, her own composition and a song featured in the movie American Beauty. She died in 1998 at the age of 69.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Betty Carter

questions.question: This soft -voiced Dakota-born singer was discovered by Benny Goodman. Her most famous song is Fever.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peggy Lee

questions.question: This great Chicago-born singer was married to Max Roach and sang on his famous We Insist!-Freedom Now Suite. She appeared in such movies as For the Love of Ivy” and Nothing but a Man. One of her signature songs is Buddy Can You Spare a Dime?.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abbey Lincoln

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Band and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, vocalist, welsh. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What actress portrayed real-life author Betty Mahmoody in the 1991 drama movie Not Without My Daughter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sally Field

questions.question: This singer was called The Queen of the blues. She was born Ruth Lee Jones in Alabama in 1924 and her career began at age 15. She changed her name and developed a distinctive singing style. Her most popular hit was What a Difference a Day Made.”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dinah Washington

questions.question: Rhiannon was not just a woman, she was a mythological Welsh Goddess. What band had a big hit with the song Rhiannon (Will You Ever Win)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fleetwood Mac

questions.question: Although Lola walked like a woman, she did talk like a man, in a hit by this band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Kinks

questions.question: Fill in the blank with this Elvis Costello song title from his first album.  ______________, I know this world is killing you.  Oh, ____________, my aim is true.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alison

questions.question: What popular band performed the 1977 song Ma Baker?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boney M.

questions.question: This band sang about wanting Opheila to come back home on their 1978 album The Last Waltz. The song was also featured on their Greatest Hits album released in 2000.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Band

questions.question: My Sharona was released in 1979 and became a huge hit for this band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Knack

questions.question: Which vocalist with a remarkably smooth baritone voice was known for the songs I Apologize, Prisoner of Love, and My Foolish Heart?”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Eckstine

questions.question: What great musician appeared in the 1980 movie The Blues Brothers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What huge action movie star starred as the twin brother of Danny DeVito in the 1988 comedy movie Twins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arnold Schwarzenegger

questions.question: What comedian starred as Sonny Koufax in the 1999 comedy movie Big Daddy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adam Sandler

questions.question: In what country would you hear the tuva singing of Buddhist monks of the Dalai Lama?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tibet

questions.question: Which of the following actresses portrayed the American Presidents daughter in the 2004 movie First Daughter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katie Holmes

questions.question: Solomon Linda, an African Zulu, wrote and recorded this song in 1939 that The Tokens took to the top of the Billboard Hot 100 in 1961.  Can you name the African lullaby and Broadway tune that begins  A-Wimoweh, a-wimoweh?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lion Sleeps Tonight

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Singer
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, diva, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This singer had a hit song in 1977 with Lovely Day.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Withers

questions.question: This highway bisects the entire country.  It is where Route 45 crosses this highway that blues great , Robert Johnson,  sold his soul to the devil.  Elvis Presley was born along this highway and Bessie Smith died on this highway.  Bob Dylan wrote that on this highway you could find Georgia Sam, Mack the finger, Louie the king and the second mother with the seventh son.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Highway 61

questions.question: This diva had a huge #1 U.S. hit in 1990 with Love Takes Time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mariah Carey

questions.question: Day Dreaming was a big hit song for this RB diva in the 1970s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aretha Franklin

questions.question: Tall and tan and young and lovely introduces The Girl from Ipanema.  One can picture the beaches of Brazil as each one she passes goes aahhh.  The Girl from Ipanema was an international hit and introduced the bossa nova to a world audience.  However, in the lyrics of the song, what dance does the singer compare her to as she swings so cool and sways so gentle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samba

questions.question: Now for the U.S.A.  Mr. Farber writes  razor sharp guitar riffs, driving beat and snarling vocal makes this 1969 Steppenwolf song the  biker rallying cry .  When I hear this song, I think of the movie  Easy Rider  as Captain America and Billy ride their bikes towards New Orleans and their destiny.   What is the name of the song that  listening to can make anyone feel like an outlaw?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Born to be Wild

questions.question: Wasted Days and Wasted Nights was one of the biggest songs ever for this singer in 1975.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Freddy Fender

questions.question: The instrument is the bouzouki.  The song is Kritikos Horos.  What is the name of the movie that finds Anthony Quinn dancing on the beach at Stavros
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zorba the Greek

questions.question: Little cable cars climb halfway to the stars croons the singer of  I Left My Heart in San Francisco.  Who is the singer most closely identified with the city by the bay?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tony Bennett

questions.question: The 1972 song Day By Day was a huge hit from this musical.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Godspell

questions.question: This female group from the 1990s had a #1 hit in the U.S. with Youre in Love.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wilson Phillips

questions.question: One Love, One Heart.  Lets get together and feel alright.  The lyrics and music of this song brings to ones inner eye the beauty of the island of Jamaica.  Yet examine closely the lyrics of  One Love ,  and you will find the concern this artist had for the poor and repressed people of Jamaica.  Who is this artist that helped bring reggae music to the attention of the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Marley

questions.question: Daydream was a big hit song for this 1960s band from NYC.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lovin Spoonful

questions.question: This singer had a mammoth #1 hit in the U.S. with Love Will Lead You Back.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Taylor Dayne

questions.question: Domenico Modugno wrote Nel blu dipinto di blu.  Dean Martin sings, Volare, oh oh.  E Contare, oh, oh. oh oh.  In America we know this breezy song as  Volare .  What does Volare mean in Italian?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To fly
